perturbation.original_text:
1.5 "Co-Branded Service" means the service to be developed
under this Agreement, including Enhancements, which will be offered to Dassault
Systemes Customers via the Dassault Systemes Web site(s) and will contain
translation and healing application services substantially similar to those
currently offered and sold on the PlanetCAD Web site(s) as of the Effective Date
under the product name 3Dshare.com, and based upon the CBD Software.
perturbation.changed_text:
1.5 "Co-Branded Service" means the service to be developed
under this Agreement, including Enhancements, which may be offered to Dassault
Systemes Customers via any web site at PlanetCad's discretion and may contain any application services.
It does not have to be substantially similar to those currently offered and sold on the PlanetCAD Web site(s) as of the Effective Date
under the product name 3Dshare.com, and may or may not be based upon the CBD Software.
perturbation.explanation: The original text defines the co-branded service with specific limitations on its features and target audience, offered through Dassault Systemes websites. The modified version broadens this definition by allowing PlanetCAD to host and offering any application services, potentially contradicting the original intent of a co-branded, Dassault Systemes-centric service. Creates uncertainty on what the final service should entail.

perturbation.original_text:
3.5 Know-How. The parties hereby acknowledge and agree that
any and all rights to Know-How developed or shared under this Agreement by
either party shall be jointly owned by the parties and may be used by either
party in the operation of their respective businesses during and following
termination of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text:
3.5 Know-How. The parties hereby acknowledge and agree that
any and all rights to Know-How developed or shared under this Agreement by
either party shall be owned by the contributing party and may be used by contributing party
alone in the operation of their respective businesses during and following
termination of this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause specifies joint ownership of know-how, allowing both parties to use it. The modified clause assigns ownership to the contributing party, restricting the other party's use, thus contradicting the initial joint ownership agreement. This creates uncertainty about who can use the know-how developed during the agreement. Can cause legal disputes for future use of data or code made during the deal.

perturbation.original_text:
10.1 Term. This Agreement shall be effective as of the
Effective Date and shall continue in force for three years from the Launch Date
(the "Initial Term") unless earlier
terminated in accordance with this Section (the "Term"). The Agreement shall
automatically renew for successive one year additional terms unless terminated
by either party at least six months prior to the expiration of the then-current
term.
perturbation.changed_text:
10.1 Term. This Agreement shall be effective as of the
Effective Date and shall continue in force for three years from the Launch Date
(the "Initial Term") unless earlier
terminated in accordance with this Section (the "Term"). The Agreement shall
automatically renew for successive one year additional terms unless terminated
by either party at least six months prior to the expiration of the then-current
term. The agreement can be terminated at any moment by either party.
perturbation.explanation: The original text says the contract automatically renews, unless one party says otherwise 6 months prior. The change states the contract can be cancelled at any time, even with a prior agreement to renew. This invalidates the original terms for renewal, thus causing a contradiction.
